image_worker.preprocess¶

image_worker.preprocess.processer¶

A module to preprocess images if needed.

class image_worker.preprocess.processer.Processer¶

Bases: object

A class to use different preprocessing methods.

run_resize(size=(256, 256))¶

A simple method to resize the images. Only resizes the images to the specified folder. Does not iterate through down the directory tree.

sizetuple

The size of the image.

ValueError

If the input_path or output_path is not specified. If the size is not a tuple. If the size is not specified.

>>> from image_worker.preprocess import Processer
>>> processer = Processer()
>>> processer.specify_input_and_output_path("/path/to/input/folder", "/path/to/output/folder", "jpg")
>>> processer.run_resize((256, 256))
Resized images from the specified folder.
specify_input_and_output_path(input_path, output_path, type_of_image=None)¶

Specify the path to the data.

input_pathstr

The path to the folder where the images are.

output_pathstr

The path to the folder where the images will be saved.

type_of_imagestr

The type of the image you want to augment.

ValueError

If the input_path or output_path is not a string. If the input_path or output_path is not specified. If type_of_image is not None, “jpg” og “png”.

>>> from image_worker.preprocess import Processer
>>> processer = Processer()
>>> processer.specify_input_and_output_path("/path/to/input/folder", "/path/to/output/folder", "jpg")
Specified input path, output path and type of image to be preprocessed.
